attributes.action: Set up law to exempt spouse and parents of those KIA from council tax for life
attributes.background:
There is no law at present which exempts spouse and parents of those members of the armed forces, security services, NHS and police killed during their service or when on operations. 
To honour them, I want UK legislation to excuse their spouse and parents from council tax liability for life

attributes.action: Change restrictions on legal aid so that everyone can have 1 free appeal
attributes.background: Legal aid has strict criteria making it difficult unless on benefits to get free representation when convicted of a crime. The criteria should be changed allowing anyone the right to have legal aid for the appeal process regardless of people earnings.
attributes.additional_details: People that are wrongfully convicted have no chance of appeal unless they pay for representation and this can be an average cost of £5000. Most people in the United Kingdom are denied the chance due to criteria. If household income is less than £40,000 a year people should have the right to legal aid and appeals

attributes.action: Alter "laws" that bar certain Brits from jobs with the Secret Service.
attributes.background: The Home Office, FCO, MI5,MI6,HMGCC & other Gov’ Offices reject applicants simply because they don’t have a British Parent with British ties; even if they have a Naturalization Certificate and a British Passport. That these documents do “NOT” make one British enough to be appointed is unacceptable!
attributes.additional_details: Evidence is the Criterium openly set out as advertised on the Foreign Offices’ websites and MI5, MI6, also enshrined in UK Law.

attributes.action: Introduce Online Sales Tax to fund NHS spending increase
attributes.background:
The Government has "gifted" the NHS an extra £20bn of our money, proposed through raising yet more tax on middle and higher income earners!

An Online Sales Tax directed against Google, Amazon, eBay, Twitter etc should be used to offset tax rises for stretched families and save our high street.
attributes.additional_details:
Amazon and Google both generated £7bn in sales revenue in 2017.  A new OST of 12% (on top of VAT) would generate £1.8bn per annum alone.  Facebook did £850m in sales, generating another £100m OST for the pot.

Middle and higher income earners are not a limitless well of money for the Government to keep dipping into.  The top 1% of income earners already pay more than 28% of all income tax.  This is unsustainable in the long term and we need to reduce taxes & seek efficiency savings.

attributes.action: Recall of UK ambassador to the US in protest about detaining children in cages.
attributes.background: The United States government has implemented a policy on 06/04/2018 to separate and detain children of asylum seekers entering the US. This is an illegal and inhuman act. By withdrawing (recalling) the UK's ambassador to the US this send a strong an clear message that this is not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Since June 2018 US Customs and Border Portection have been forcibly removing children from their parents, people claiming asylum. These children have and are being detained in centres little more than cages and tented cities. The children are numbered and tagged. The US government has now opened 'Tender Age Shelters' to house babies and infants. See:

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/rachel-maddow-cries-tender-age-shelters-video-us-migrant-children-separated-parents-a8407436.html

attributes.action: Provide clarity around the powers & legislation of bailiffs & civil enforcement
attributes.background: Civil enforcement agencies and bailiffs are a private entity which are used to recover debt. There have been a large number of cases where these enforcement agents are providing misleading information occupiers at properties which generally leaves no choice but to make payments in full.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to this lack of clarity police are called to such instances around 89% of times, wasting police time as they can not enforce anything except ensure there is no breach in peace as the matter is of a civil nature. 

If warrants had stated thereon the powers of entry a bailiff or enforcement may have according to the type of warrant they are present to execute, this would be beneficial all parties including the police as they generally have no knowledge about the rights of these agents

attributes.action: Introduce retail transaction tax and abolish retailers’ business rates
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  This disproportionate cost is contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% retail business rate tax on each sales transaction value rather than property space would be a fairer arrangement and would be directly linked to the business’s success rather than the cause of its failure. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place. The credit card holder’s physical location (in-store) or credit card address (online) are readily available for re-allocation to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Stop Water companies from draining UK taxable profits by ‘Earnings Stripping’
attributes.background: Utilities companies’ taxable profits are being drained by large foreign-owned multinationals. The profits subsidise their global monopolization and enrich the 1% high wealth investors. Government’s tax revenue destined for health and welfare is being permanently lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Multinationals reduce their taxable profits by deducting interest payments on loans held by another subsidiary located in a low tax jurisdiction.
 
The Government should change tax regulation to prevent this and should: 
-disallow for tax purposes the company’s interest expense on non-infrastructure borrowings and cap annual deduction to 1% of turnover; 
-disallow all non-UK intragroup recharges from subsidiaries/related parties above 5% of turnover.

attributes.action: Change GCSE's Grades From 9-1 to 1-9
attributes.background: Most people get confused with the new GCSE's grading system and personally i do not like it.

attributes.action: Remove the household means assessment from student loans for all adult students.
attributes.background:
Parental maintenance cease at 18. The UK government assesses an entitlement to a student loan for an adult upon the income of people who live in their household but may have had no previous financial responsibility for ? 
Allow all students to apply for the maximum award. It’s all repayable
attributes.additional_details: The student loan assessment is unfair. A common example is where a students mother lives with a new partner. The partner earns a good salary and pays maintenance for his existing children - however the student applying for university must ask this man, who s/he may only have known for a year for their financial details. Then will be awarded a lesser sum because of this man income . With the expectation that he will top up the reduced loan. This rarely happens leaving the student disadvantaged.

attributes.action: Allow the purchase of alcohol between 8am and 11pm
attributes.background: The purchase of alcohol should be allowed between 8am and 11pm as the times the law describe are just too late. I have personal relations with close friends who are heavily reliant on alcohol and need it for medicinal reasons but have to endure a long mornings and nights in pain.
attributes.additional_details: It is understood the reasons for the times that are set but i honestly feel the reasons behind this law have now become mostly irrelevant. It is unfair on these people who have to suffer most mornings and nights because of this. It is hard seeing close ones in these situations.

attributes.action: Remove home address from UK Driving Licence.
attributes.background: Most people carry their driving licence and house keys together.  Having your home address on the licence is unnecessary as all information will be attached to the licence number.  It's time to end this potentially dangerous practice.

attributes.action: Inquiry on collapse of Monarch & the safeguarding of pensions
attributes.background: There have been calls for a public inquiry to the collapse of Monarch airlines and maybe look into changing the law on pensions so when a company goes into administration money can be put aside for the pension fund.
attributes.additional_details: The Chair of Parliament’s Work and Pensions Committee expressed concern over claims that private equity group Greybull Capital could avoid losing money while the carrier’s pension fund – which is owed £7.5m – could be among creditors left with nothing.

attributes.action: Legalise assisted dying for terminal illnesses.
attributes.background: It's wrong that doctors have to keep alive people who are in either serious physical or mental distress when they wish to end their own lives.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone should be able to do whatever they want with their own lives. We're all supposed to live in a country where we supposedly have pure freedom. People can't end their lives if their life is a horror every day.

attributes.action: British Sign Language Should be taught in Primary and Secondary schools in UK.
attributes.background: Children who are deaf should have the choice of which school they want to go to, but the problem with this is integrating with other children cause BSL (British Sign Language) is not part of the National Curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 1 in every 1000 children is born with a severe or profound hearing loss. 90% of all deaf children are born to hearing parents. Approximately 50,000 deaf people in the UK use British Sign Language (BSL) as their first or preferred language.

Deaf children in the UK aged 0 to 15 is at 23000 so it shows that BSL should be in the National Curriculum so our children can integrate with the deaf community and BSL would be a language they would use lots off time in there life.

attributes.action: Increase funding for mental health services and accommodation for veterans
attributes.background: Thousands of ex-military personnel are currently either homeless or suffering with mental health issues. It is diabolical that people who have served this country are being left behind in such a manner; it is high time for the government to start actively tackling this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/least-13000-hero-soldiers-left-11847000

https://www.bbc.com/news/health-45761546

attributes.action: Require weekly nature protection classes in schools
attributes.background: I graduated the theoretical high school Stefan Banulescu in Romania. The high school at that time  owned the GREEN FLAG provided by the European Inspectors who mattered with that high school.
attributes.additional_details: I would like environmental protection classes aim at cleaning parks, gardening, proper care of plants and animals. Excursions to the zoo, proximity to the natural environment that is existential to be saved, and many other innovative things that can be brought into discussion in some projects.

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be sold in registered gun shops
attributes.background:
Restrict the sale of fireworks to just registered gun dealers. Gun dealers are competent and qualified in firearms and ammunition so are certainly the right people for judging whom they sell too.
 This will prevent fireworks from falling into the hands of youths and the wrong people.

attributes.action: Require all co.s  to have transparent complaints procedures & call waiting times
attributes.background: Many companies do not want to undergo the trouble and expense of engaging with their customers. Where customers have limited choice, there is limited recourse for customers, who have received a poor service or no service at all.
attributes.additional_details: A flight in July was cancelled by Easyjet. They have not paid compensation that is due. I have called four times and been kept waiting on each occasion more than half an hour, listening to a recording that blames 'unusual call volumes'. On the one occasion I spoke to a human, they explained that the systems were down and terminated the call.

attributes.action: Public investigation into treatment of people with autism/learning difficulties
attributes.background: Call on the government to investigate and reform the law so that the rights of parents, guardians or next of kin of people with autism/learning difficulties cannot be removed. Re: https://news.sky.com/story/40-people-died-in-barbaric-secure-hospitals-the-government-pledged-would-close-11540038
attributes.additional_details: It is in the general public’s best interest an investigation is carried out into the circumstances of the loss of life of people with a profound learning disability or autism who have died while admitted to secure hospitals or care homes over the last 40 yrs. Currently more than 2000 people are in assessment and treatment units with an average stay of more than 5 ½ years when they are supposed to be discharged within 18 months and their families do not have any right in deciding their treatment

attributes.action: Ban religious studies in schools
attributes.background: Religion does not belong in the school system. I do not send my child to school to learn about religion - that is what church is for.

attributes.action: More Money For Unemployed
attributes.background: Unemployed People Like Myself Struggle To Put Food On The Table. Afford Gas And Electric And Rent Top Ups. We Should Get Additional Support From DWP

attributes.action: Make it illegal for under 16's to have internet access on their mobile phones!
attributes.background: Children exposed to pornography at 9, cyber bullying see evidence link. Teenagers committing suicide because of cyber bullying, outrageous! They need constant supervision with the internet! It is far too dangerous and the safety of our children is the most important. It goes beyond parents control.
attributes.additional_details:
https://foreverymom.com/mom-gold/horror-stories-real-dont-give-children-smartphone-jonathon-van-maren/

I will give my daughter a cell phone when she is in year 6 and practising getting to school on her own ready for high school, but it will not have access to the internet, thats not going to stop other children who do have internet access from showing her inappropriate pictures or posting things about her though is it! For this to stop it needs to be illegal. They do not need internet access!

attributes.action: Fund overnight hostels for homeless people in each town and city
attributes.background: I wish for this to happen because homeless people are not treated fairly in today’s society and wish to show people that everyone is equal.
attributes.additional_details: If people are living on the streets then it could cause more health condition and cost more money for the NHS which is already struggling as quite clearly proven

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.

attributes.action: Government to ban the production and use of all non-recyclable plastic by 2020.
attributes.background: Plastic is choking each and every one of us.  It has filled the land, sea and air. We may not want to accept it but it is in our face. We would like the government to take the initiative to stop the production so it is not available for use in UK and other countries will follow.
attributes.additional_details:
A Roadmap for Sustainability report found more than 60 countries have introduced bans which are one of the most effective ways to reduce the use of disposable plastic.
Plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose in landfills. But plastic bags we use in our everyday life take 10-1000 years to decompose, burning it is not an option as well as it releases toxic fumes into the air.
UN warned at current levels the earth could be awash with 12 billion tonnes of plastic trash by the middle of the century.

attributes.action: Remove disability exemptions for the armed forces from the 2010 Equality Act
attributes.background: I was recently rejected by the Lancaster UOTC because of my Autism even though during their selection day in Liverpool I passed all their selection tests and completed all the required paperwork. They rejected me because I declared that I had a medical condition (Autism)
attributes.additional_details:
They rejected me because I declared on one of the medical forms that I have a medical condition (Autism). I had to declare it as it was a legal requirement. 
 
https://apply.army.mod.uk/how-to-join/can-i-join/medical
 
Autism is not included, yet on other British Army medical forms, one must disclose their Autism, and in turn they can be discriminated against because of this due to the exemption from parts of the Equality Act 2010.

attributes.action: Make cat calling an illegal act in the UK
attributes.background:
Cat calling refers to the act of shouting harassing and often sexually suggestive, threatening, or derisive comments at someone publicly. 

Surveys have found that 85% of people under 40 years old have taken a different route home to avoid harassment. Cat Calling should not have this power.
attributes.additional_details:
End Violence Against Women Coalition commissioned YouGov to conduct the first national poll on street harassment in 2016. The poll found that 64% of women of all ages have experienced unwanted sexual harassment in public places.

There are laws in the UK which focus on sexual misconduct but none specifically related to catcalling. This is not an impossible task with countries like Portugal, Belgium and France having already implemented such laws.

attributes.action: Don't add the age verification and censoring on porn sites
attributes.background:
The government plans to add age verification and censoring on porn sites. 

We believe this is censorship via a back door.

We believe this will mean the UK will block many sites (just like China does).
attributes.additional_details:
It will increase pirated and probably illegal porn as it will end up only the criminals supplying porn.

We see each day sites hacked and data leaked, so we fear peoples details will be leaked online.

attributes.action: To change the Gambling Act to protect minors from loot boxes in computer games.
attributes.background: Games companies are making poor quality games to maximize player spending. Players are gambling real world currency, by exchanging it for virtual currency to play built in slot machines. There are match making algorithms to match weaker players with better ones.
attributes.additional_details:
This will make the weaker player jealous, tempting them to gambling money on the loot boxes on the pay-to-win game. Gambling can be addictive, and children are more susceptible to being addicted. All the transactions and electronically automated, so children with no concept of money will keep opening loot boxes. It's a very scummy, shady tactic used by some games companies. And it's typically the case that the only thing you can buy in the game is solely the virtual currency for opening loot boxes in one game mode
 
Please sign

attributes.action: Label all ingredients (including soy oil) and create a soy tax
attributes.background: There are many people suffering from multiple food allergies, soy being one of the main culprits. It is hidden under more than 70 different names. I myself have purchased a product labelled 100% turkey and ended up in hospital because soy oil was not labelled. Allergies need to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: I have emailed the supplier of this product and all they have done is acknowledge they had soy oil in the product and offered a £4 refund. This is not enough. I was ill for a month. This is serious. Prepackaged food is over processed and has added soy in for no beneficial reason other than the fact it is a cheap alternative for the manufacturers. There is a sugar tax in action and I think there should also be a soy tax.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all adults working with children to be first aid trained.
attributes.background: Not all members of preschool/school staff are first aid trained only a select few. Trained adults can be absent from work or out on a course or a school trip and leave the school without a first aider. This is a particular issue at lunchtimes in school when the adult ratio to children is often low.
attributes.additional_details: Children can have many complex medical needs/ food allergies. As well as everyday trips and bumps in the playground. Unfortunately acciends have been reported in the news and a recent case of a boy choking at lunchtime. All staff should be trained to avoid being left without a first aider for our children when they need one. All adults working with children should know what to do.

attributes.action: Fund non-vocational degrees for people over 60
attributes.background: The Government should fund unallocated university places for non-vocational degrees for free, or for substantially reduced fees, to citizens over 60 who can demonstrate that they would be capable of completing their courses at a satisfactory level of attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
To expand on the idea of the U3A approach and to formalise it into a higher level of attainment for those wishing to pursue academic recognition.

To explore the Chinese model of learning available to older citizens in China: 
http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201806/23/WS5b2d4787a3103349141de584.html

attributes.action: Set up a single tribunal service for all public services complaints/ grievances.
attributes.background: Call on the government to create a fair free tribunal body and procedure to hear complaints/grievances/appeals relating to failure, mistakes or misuse of power by those in all public services who conceal their wrongdoing.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact to people affected is simply being normalised and accepted as the way things are.

The public must have a right to a fair tribunal service & charter which allows their concerns to be heard when they have suffered failure/mistakes & gives the tribunal more powers to compel witnesses/public officers to testify. The public’s rights matter & they must be entitled to free access to justice & due process in disputes before an impartial judge as those in public office can use public money to conceal failure/mistakes & those affected have no voice & most cannot access legal assistance.

attributes.action: Pass the Restroom Access Act 2005 (Ally's Law) in the UK
attributes.background: The Restroom Access Act 2005 is an act in the USA that requires establishments that have toilet facilities for their employees to also allow customers to use the facilities if the customer suffers from an inflammatory bowel disease or other medical conditon requiring immediate access to a toilet.
attributes.additional_details: There is not enough awareness of IBD in the UK, hopefully signing this petition will help bring out this awareness and pass the Act.

attributes.action: Impose mandatory funeral funding clause upon private pension providers.
attributes.background: When my partner's father passed on, his family struggled to pay the cost of his funeral, in spite of not applying for the funeral funding payout from the job centre, which they were eligible for. We see non-UK nationals work lifelong, only to see their families impoverished by the cost of funerals.
attributes.additional_details: Families of nationals and non-UK nationals that provide an excellent service to the country are often left in a position where they cannot apply for state funeral funding because of the UK benefits system and its applications toward specific situations. Time of death cannot be predicted but private pension pay-ins are lifelong and should fund a funeral, which is the most costly part of some people's lives. The saddest day of one's life should never also be the most internally destructive.

attributes.action: Make both GCSE English papers optional
attributes.background: I want to the government to remove English from the compulsory or “core” subjects. This is due to the fact that analysis of poems and a 400 year old play will never benefit most people in the working world. In the modern world STEM subjects are much more important and English is irrelevant.

attributes.action: Create an ombudsman for the travel industry
attributes.background: At the moment when a person has a complaint regarding the travel industry the only person they can complain to is the travel member or ABTA. If there was an ombudsman appointed then the customer would stand a better chance of being helped by someone who is independent.

attributes.action: Mental health checkups should be completed yearly from a young age on the NHS
attributes.background: Mental health checkups through the NHS should be followed out just as physical health checks are done yearly from a young age.

attributes.action: Anti depressants should be free to everyone who suffers depression.
attributes.background: I’m calling for this to be reviewed, contraception is free on the NHS, but a person with a mental disability (depression) is to be charged for having what can’t be prevented. For people who work, prescriptions are chargeable, assuming people can afford it. This is not the case.

attributes.action: Help fund the NHS so people can have (Otoplasty-Pinnaplasty) surgery.
attributes.background:
I would like to have cosmetic surgery as my ears stick out a bit,  I’ve been to my doctors and seen different doctors and they said I might not be accepted due to funding and not have a good case.

I suffer from Body Dysmorphic Disorder and severe depression, having  ears pinned would help a bit.
attributes.additional_details:
People who need and would like to have Otoplasty surgery can’t get it done due to NHS not funded enough. It costs too much going private and either myself and/or other people who want Otoplasty can’t afford it. It’s not right that myself or others would have to go private. The cost is about £2,500-£3,500 plus any consultations etc.

I want to get this done as it’s causimg me significant Psychological distress and others feel the same. I don’t want to go privately to get cosmetic surgery.

attributes.action: Provide Network Rail with funding for the second entrance at Putney Station
attributes.background:
Wandsworth Council have been pushing for a 2nd entrance to Putney Station for years, but have failed to secure funding.

This project would improve access between SWT and District Line and reduce congestion in the main entrance. Please back this project with government funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Wandsworth Council article showing the benefits to locals:
http://www.wandsworth.gov.uk/news/article/13181/rail_passengers_urged_to_quiz_rail_chiefs_on_new_station_entrance

Local Guardian article about the plans:
http://www.yourlocalguardian.co.uk/news/10636235.Train_bosses_urged_to_consider_second_entrance_plan_for_Putney_station/

Putney High Street is also one of the most polluted roads in London, so this project would have health benefits, as well as saving time for passengers.

attributes.action: Create a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children
attributes.background: Introduce a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children. I propose a small tax on all goods sold in England. The tax money will buy food for starving African children. Food security is very important, because when people have no money or food, eventually wars happen.
attributes.additional_details: Overall, 5.6 million children under age five died in 2016, nearly 15,000 daily. The risk of a child dying before five years of age is highest in Africa - about 8 times higher than in Europe. Eventually if other countries from around the world put a tax on their goods too, this international tax money would help collapsed economies from around the world, so it would be like a world social security ensuring the world to be a safer world to live in for everyone.

attributes.action: Proscribe the Bangladesh Chhatra (Student) League
attributes.background: Members of the Bangladesh Chhatra (Student) League have been attacking people, including women, elderly, indigenous peoples, students.
attributes.additional_details:
We appeal for peace and justice and that is why we are reaching out to international community to find avenues to protect children of Bangladesh. We are seeking your help! To start with, Bangladesh Chhatra (Student) League needs to be recognized and proscribed by the UK as a terrorist organization.
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-45069935
 
http://www.foxnews.com/world/2018/08/04/police-protesters-clash-in-bangladesh-capital-many-injured.html”

attributes.action: To make the M5 north and south bond to 4/5 lanes wide from Exeter to Bristol.
attributes.background: The M5 north and south bond is one of the most congested motorways in the country and each week thousands of people are stuck in heavy traffic jams turning1 hour trips into 4 hours of stand still traffic. Extending each side to 4 or 5 lanes would increase the flow of traffic and decrease congestion.

attributes.action: Make using red flashing lights on recovery trucks mandatory.
attributes.background: In 2018 alone we have had some very tragic incidents on the roads that could of been prevented. A lack of concentration whilst driving at speed is killing innocent workers. More needs to be done to protect workers roadside. Hitting a stationary vehicle on the hard shoulder shouldn't happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike blue flashing lights, amber lights grant no priority in traffic and are used to solely to emphasize a vehicle, often due to being a hazard. AKA non important
.Vehicles that use amber flashing lights include:

Road / highway maintenance vehicle 
Refuse collection vehicle
Breakdown recovery vehicle
the list goes on.

Most vehicles that do any kind of civil work have amber flashing lights, they are abused and misused, giving drivers the indication they are not important. This needs to change. All recovery trucks to have flashing reds fitted so motorist understand drivers need the room to operate. Workers to return home safe, not in a coffin.

attributes.action: UK Government should work with Dumfries and Galloway Council to house refugees
attributes.background: Many refugees live in awful horrible conditions and we do not. There is so much space here in Dumfries and Galloway and I want the refugees to have the same opportunities that we have.
attributes.additional_details: Countries close to war torn countries have begun to refuse letting in refugees. It is a selfish act to deprive others of the things we take for granted every day. Let refugees come here.

attributes.action: Introduce a minimum rate of tax on tax avoidance schemes to help fund the NHS
attributes.background: The introduction of a minimum income/corporate tax rate for individuals/companies would immediately raise tens of billions in additional tax receipts each year to help fund the NHS without the need to raise existing tax rates for the middle-classes, cut funding for benefits or borrow more money.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, tax avoiders can legally reduce the tax liability on their income to next to nothing without any restriction or recourse!

Any individual/company based in the UK that uses a known avoidance scheme or has connected parties/subsidiaries whose effective tax rate is less than 15% should pay the new minimum tax rate. 
The New 15% Minimum Tax Rate will apply to UK income and to all income recorded in low tax jurisdictions whether or not it is remitted back to UK.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for those working between 9pm and 7am to £14 p/h
attributes.background: Workers of late shifts—which have been proven to have detrimental effects on health—are increasingly common, and these workers are being exploited.
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco—who made a £1·6bl profit last quarter—pay staff near minimum wage to work until midnight. Clubs hire 18–21-year-olds at £5.60/h till 5.The real living wage in the U.K. is nearly £10/h: https://bbc.in/2JGrY0b This work is unhealthy and those employed deserve compensation.

Study noting an increase in the risk of an early death amongst night-shift workers: https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/2015/oct/28/night-shift-three-million-workers-health-risks-obesity-cancer-diabetes

Radio 4 on damage to organs and the brain caused by nightwork: https://www.ajpmonline.org/article/S0749-3797(14)00623-0/fulltext

https://www.psych.ox.ac.uk/news/how-can-working-night-shifts-affect-mental-and-physical-health

attributes.action: Regulate prescription fees from all UK veterinary surgeons.
attributes.background: Unregulated, vets can now charge what they like for writing prescriptions. A £5.00 standard charge should be made law to enable already over charged clients to purchase medications elsewhere such as a Animal chemist for often up to 800% cheaper than buying from a vet.
attributes.additional_details: Above information is easily checked by anyone having an invoice from their vet for medications and comparing same items on price with various animal chemists that are found on line.
